column4: anyone ever get the following in their dmesg?  "Unable to handle kernel paging request at virtual address 00323533..."
bad ram or kernel bug
or bad swap
hmm
the RAM has been working for a while but recently windows had trouble installing on this machine, so I decided to install Linux
working doesn't mean it's not bad.
:P
memory problems are nasty
probably not a kernel bug...  any idea how I could deal with it?
without buying ram, that is :P
run memtest on the system for a few hrs
test the disk with badblocks or similar
how much ram is there?
well, if I run memtest and it reports an error - and I don't want to buy ram... is there a way I can just work-around the ram :P
linux supports memory holes
sweet :)
that's what I was hoping for...
there was a patch floating around where you could specify a region of the physical map that was dodgy to avoid.
that's awesome
I don't know if it was merged into the mainline kernel
